Posts.Content: Quote: Originally Posted by alexioda I am scheduled for a mammogram in two weeks and I'm scared. I don't know what to expect so I would love to hear about other people experiences. Does it hurt? How long does it take?
Posts.Title: First mammogram/what to expect?

Posts.Content: Not to worry about the mammogram; there is little discomfort if any. I have had many over the last 25 years, and the technicians have all been very pleasant, cheerful, and willing to assuage any fears. We are blessed to have this technology at our hands!
Posts.Title: First mammogram/what to expect?

Posts.Content: Breasts can be sore for a little bit after a mammogram. I have not heard of accessory breast tissue; although I have been called back in 6 months a couple times for microcalcifications. You might save yourself from needless anxiety by calling your doctor and asking him this question; he would probably have the report in hand by now.
Posts.Title: First mammogram/what to expect?
